info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 5:57PM EDT until July 25 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids MI
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Michigan, including the following counties, in south central Michigan, Calhoun. In southwest Michigan, Kalamazoo.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen in the last hour, and an additional 1 to 1.5 inches of rain is possible over the next hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kalamazoo, Portage, Marshall, Battle Creek, Galesburg, Parchment, Climax, Richland, Gull Lake, Comstock Northwest, Brownlee Park, Westwood, Augusta, Scotts, Bedford, Comstock, Ceresco and Oshtemo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT
